page.title: 13PRIMROSE LANE MILL
page.content: The mill was built in about 1830 but has only been a mill since the 1920's. Before then it was a warehouse and the lane was called Warehouse Lane. There are about 20 people employed and some of them are paid to operate the 15 power looms otherwise known as dog cross that are kept. They make cloth to order to countries world wide such as Japan, Canada, United States, Germany, Italy, France and Austria. When the cloth gets to the foreign countries it is usually sold in tourist shops. They get the raw materials from merchants in Bradford and then they dye it as it is also a dye house and then they make it into ties and hats. Mr. Tunbridge, manager of the mill for 9 years said products have changed with fashion. Most of the products are made from the wool of the Jacob's sheep.
